Sentencas: Interconnect coatings are extremely important to ensure an optimal performance of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stack.
Titulo: Microstructural and Electrical Characterization of Plasma Sprayed Cu-Mn Oxide Spinels as Coating on Metallic Interconnects for Stacking Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Nowadays the most common material used to produce SOFC interconnects is a ferritic stainless steel (FSS) rich in chromium which is much less expensive than the previously used ceramic interconnects.
Titulo: Microstructural and Electrical Characterization of Plasma Sprayed Cu-Mn Oxide Spinels as Coating on Metallic Interconnects for Stacking Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Nevertheless interconnects have to be coated in order to provide protection from the aggressive environment that surrounds them and reduce chromium species migration to the cell's cathode.
Titulo: Microstructural and Electrical Characterization of Plasma Sprayed Cu-Mn Oxide Spinels as Coating on Metallic Interconnects for Stacking Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this work three different coatings were applied to Crofer((R))
Titulo: Microstructural and Electrical Characterization of Plasma Sprayed Cu-Mn Oxide Spinels as Coating on Metallic Interconnects for Stacking Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: 22 H substrates viaatmospheric plasma spraying (APS): two different stoichiometries of copper manganese oxide (CuxMn3-xO4, where x=1.4 and 1.5) and one of cobalt manganese oxide (CoxMn3-xO4, where x=1.5), considered the state of the art coating for SOFC interconnects.
Titulo: Microstructural and Electrical Characterization of Plasma Sprayed Cu-Mn Oxide Spinels as Coating on Metallic Interconnects for Stacking Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction (XRD) was used to check the composition of deposited layers.
Titulo: Microstructural and Electrical Characterization of Plasma Sprayed Cu-Mn Oxide Spinels as Coating on Metallic Interconnects for Stacking Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Area specific resistance (ASR) of samples has been characterized for different samples in the range 673-1,073K and during a 100 hours ageing test at 1,073K. Microstructural changes and Cr-barrier properties have been characterized by SEM-EDX analyses.
Titulo: Microstructural and Electrical Characterization of Plasma Sprayed Cu-Mn Oxide Spinels as Coating on Metallic Interconnects for Stacking Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
